clues.text: A Beatles song was born when Paul McCartney's driver said he'd been very, very busy working this calendrical impossibility
Weird Al wanted to parody this Prince song by turning the year into an infomercial sales price, as in "For Only...!"
In a 1978 No. 1 hit, the Commodores sang, "You're once... twice..." this title
The Proclaimers proclaimed quite Scottishly their intention to walk this many miles; guess 804.672 km didn't scan
Regarding this Meat Loaf song, it's a yes on wanting you & needing you, but loving you... Oo, sorry! Now don't be sad, 'cause...
Pediatrician Jane Aronson has encouraged people to do this; she got her own 2 young'uns from Vietnam & Ethiopia
In 1999 this mogul & then-wife Melinda founded the Millennium Scholars Program for minority students
This actor whose food company provides for kids' charities joked that "The salad dressing is outgrossing my films"
In 1905 he published a book on Johann Sebastian Bach & then headed to French Equatorial Africa to build his hospital
In 1968 this sister of JFK founded the Special Olympics; her son Timothy Shriver now chairs the organization
An A.P. article about this habit says, "for many New Yorkers, crossing the street... against the light is a way of life"
A plan or team that comes together does this--with a J, more properly than a G
An X-Men comic book character bears this name that comes from a title of Krishna
This word for a lamentation full of complaints references an Old Testament prophet
With a name meaning "new soldier", this elite Ottoman corps ceased to be in 1826 after they rebelled against military changes
The second part of the ballet "Jewels" is named for these red gems; the dancers wear red too
This character saves the Nutcracker Prince by tossing her slipper at the Mouse King
George Balanchine choreographed this supernatural Shakespeare tale to the music of Felix Mendelssohn
In an iconic pas de deux from a 1962 performance of "Le Corsaire", Margot Fonteyn & Rudolf Nureyev traded these spins
In "Swan Lake", a sorcerer transforms his daughter Odile to look like this cursed heroine

Lima,
Cara Cara,
Navel

Ribston Pippin,
Golden Delicious, Empire

Rainier,
Montmorency, Maraschino

Adriatic,
Calimyrna,
Black Mission

Moon Drop,
Muscat,
Catawba
Jake Gyllenhaal & Rachel McAdams starred in this hard-hitting 2015 film whose title is a term for a lefty boxer
Jon Voight played Howard Cosell & Will Smith starred as this boxer in a 2001 biopic
This 2015 movie isn't about the rock band that sang "Higher"; it's about a young boxer who asks Rocky Balboa for help
"Into the Ring" & "Cutman" were episode titles of this Netflix series about a blind superhero whose dad was a boxer
In 1975 his friends entered him into the Golden Gloves as a laugh; he'd later play a boxer on "Taxi"
You've caught a pass inside your foe's 10-yard line & have a new set of downs, so this is your new down status
This alliterative edible duo is shorthand for the basic method of supporting yourself financially
This beastly phrase often describes the interplay of detective & suspect
This term for people who influence events could describe a Protestant sect that's changing addresses
This idiom meaning a noisy outburst redundantly has 2 words meaning "shout", though one sounds like a synonym for color
Todt Hill in this island borough is the highest on the Atlantic coast s. of Maine; area houses were film locations for Corleone homes
The first transatlantic wireless signal was received on Signal Hill near this capital of Newfoundland
Hills in this Los Angeles park include Mount Bell, Mount Chapel & Mount Hollywood
The first cemetery called this was located on a hill in 1867 north of Hays, Kansas, not Dodge City
This posh San Francisco neighborhood was once called California Hill after a street that runs over it
The novel "The Gold Bug Variations" has a double-stranded plot, intertwining Bach's music & cracking the code of this molecule
In the novel "The Invention of Everything Else", this inventor from the Balkans lives out his days in a New York hotel
"Thunderstruck" tells the interwoven stories of murderer Hawley Crippen & this wireless inventor
Primo Levi's memoir of his life as a young chemist is titled this, after something developed by another chemist, Dmitri Mendeleyev
A 19th c. word for a psychiatrist is the title of this Caleb Carr novel in which Dr. Laszlo Kreizler  investigates a murder
He was a Tennessee tailor way before he was U.S. president
This open letter defended Alfred Dreyfus, a Jewish officer facing treason charges by the French army
In 1949 Omar Bradley was chosen as the first chairman of this group of U.S. military advisers
In the 1950s Kathleen Kenyon excavated this city famous in biblical history & dated it to the Stone Age
A nationalistic Victorian song about war with Russia popularized this -ism for aggressive patriotism
These elves help with household chores; you can leave them milk, which is delish with the same-named dessert
This loss of visibility can happen in fog but is more common with snowy conditions
Botanically, a sequoia is a type of this
Paper for these engineering drawings is treated with ferric ammonium citrate & potassium ferricyanide
Found in front of "sapsucker" in a woodpecker's name, this hyphenated word is an insult when used on its own
Named in 1877, a Montana county honors this man who did not exactly enjoy himself in the territory the year before
At about 400,000, Pulaski is the Arkansas county with the most folks; stands to reason, with this city as the county seat
Lyon, Sac & Sioux are 3 of the 99 counties that presidential candidates try to visit in this state
This Kansas county is known for its federal pen that was home to the Birdman of Alcatraz (before he was the Birdman of Alcatraz)
The "WOW" counties of this Midwest state are Washington, Ozaukee & Waukesha

rounds.text: Introduced in 1881 to grow ornamental trees, these seeds became one of Hawaii's most valuable crops
